etymologies: mid 19th century. From re- + charter, after recharter

definitions: The renewal of a charter; a new or second charter. Chiefly used in the context of politics or business.

etymologies: late 18th century; earliest use found in John Trusler (1735–1820), Church of England clergyman and author. From re- + charter

definitions: To charter again; to give a new charter to.

notes.text: Frequently with reference to the chartering or licensing of banks.
